definition: lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
cicada
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
shell/carapace/crust (earth's crust etc)/also pr. [ke2]
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to feign death/to fake death
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom)/skulduggery/to hoodwink people/to cheat sb audaciously
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers

lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
diversionary tactic/smokescreen
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
pinyin: tang2 lang2 bu3 chan2 , huang2 que4 zai4 hou4
